greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Min { m > n | prime factorizations of m and n differ in one factor only}, a(1) = 1.
comment: A094457 gives next smaller comparable number, replacing the prime factor 2 with 1. - _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 31 2015
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{g}, g[x_] := Flatten[Table[#1, {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ x]; If[n == 1, 1, Min[Times @@ MapAt[NextPrime, g[n], #] & /@ Range[Length@ g[n]]]]]; Array[f, 71] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 31 2015 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 21 2001
